728297f-a.title: Richmond: Amboy Road - Richmond Road
728297f-a.text:
Amboy Road1 The family lives in the tar-paper shack
while the brick house grows.
1924.
P.L. Sperr
728297f-a.folder: Amboy Road & Richmond Road, Staten Island, NY

728646f-a.title: Richmond: Amboy Road - Richmond Road
728646f-a.text:
Captain Roald Anundsen Plasa, at Amboy Road.
My 18, 1937.
P. L. Sperr,
728646f-a.folder: Amboy Road & Richmond Road, Staten Island, NY

729375f-b.title: Richmond: Richmond Road - Amboy Road
729375f-b.text:
(1)
Richmond Road, at the S.W. corner of Amboy Road,
showing the Black Horse Tavern. It was a resort of
British officers during the Revolution.
Fhbruary 22, 1883
Photo by Bradish J. Carroll
From william T. Davis Collection through P.L.Sperr.
(2)  The Elack Horse Tavern, years later.
About 1910
By Mulford Simonson
Prom P.L.Sperr Collection.
(3)
At a later date.
April 30, 1929
P.L.Sperr
729375f-b.folder: Richmond Road & Amboy Road, Staten Island, NY

729376f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Road - Amboy Road
729376f-a.text:
Richmond Road (right, tracks thereon), at the S.W. corner of
Amboy Road, showing the Black Horse Tavern. It dates back to pre-
Revolutionary days and was a popular gathering place for British
officers during the War for Independence.
1924.
P. L. Sperr.
729376f-a.folder: Richmond Road & Amboy Road, Staten Island, NY
